11111111111112222.content: As your sister reaches for the side of the toilet, you hear her mumble "Maybe I shouldn't have stolen that booze." Then everything moves again, much like when you were puked out, but more orderly... and in the opposite direction. You are swirling in a whirlpool of death down... down... into a pipe totally filled with water. You bash into one of the walls, and the breath is forced out of you as you grunt in pain. Now you are frantic for air, but there is none to be found. You know that your family's toilets connect directly to the sewers (there had been problems with your septic system recently and your parents had been arguing about it quite loudly), but you doubt that you'll make it that far. Your chest is beginning to burn with the effort of holding your breath.
11111111111112222.title: Whooooosh!

choices: You have no clue where you are.
111111111111122222.content:
Suddenly, you and the flood of water and vomit are propelled from a pipe into the air, and you catch a more than welcome lungful of foul, feces-scented oxygen before falling into the most disgusting liquid you have ever seen. The canal that you are now floating in is dark green, and there is more than a little bit of human excrement floating alongside you. The area you are in is a classic sewer, a tunnel with a circular cross section and walkways on either side of a central canal of sewage. The walls on the edge of the canal are totally vertical, and far too high to clamber over. You cough at the totally overpowering odor, and swim for the shore. There's a considerable current, so you've been swept along about twenty feet by the time you reach a wall. The walls extend six inches above the surface of the poop river: a comparative fifteen feet of slick, smooth, vertical tiles. You would never escape by climbing these cliffs. You look down the river for any hope of escape but no means of egress is obvious.
A toiletful of mostly clear water, along with a large turd and a mass of soggy, soiled toilet paper splashes from a pipe in the ceiling nearby, causing ripples and splashing the putrid water around. You get an idea, and clamber onto one of the more solid-looking turds nearby, gagging from the smell. You are floating near the wall, but even with the added height granted by the floating poop you can't even reach halfway up the wall. Then, you spot your salvation. A sopping, filthy length of toilet paper has partially been ejected from the shit canal, and some of it dangles down along the wall like ivy. You judge your distance, and make a leap for the disgusting paper. You grab onto it, and the paper tears slightly on impact, but the two-ply paper seems to be holding up. You ascend the paper and heave yourself onto the tiles, panting for breath. Now the nausea that had been building this whole time overtakes you and you vomit, spewing the contents of your stomach (mostly bile, you haven't eaten much recently) into the river from which you just escaped. You spit a couple of times in an attempt to cleanse the taste from your mouth, but you can still taste bitter traces of bile.
Despair beginning to overtake you, you begin to wander down the twisting corridors. More than once you pass an iron ladder leading up to a manhole, but there is absolutely no way that you could possibly climb a ladder. You see something large moving in the distance. A rodent, four times as long as you are tall (not including the tail) scampers along the walkway. A rat. Fantastic, that's exactly what you needed. The rat seems to take no interest in you, probably having to do with you smelling like you've been swimming in shit, which you have. After what seems like an eternity of following the river, you find a door on the side of the tunnel which is, thank God, ajar. You slip through the doorway, and find a room filled with old, rumbling machines. More importantly, the floor is at an incline, leading you up towards the surface. Unfortunately, the concrete ramp soon turns into wooden stairs, which will be much more of a challenge to get up. You turn back and look around the room for anything that could help you. You spot a length of twine and a few paper clips, and you get an idea.
"This would be so much easier if I had shoes," you mutter to yourself as you attempt to bend the paperclips into precise positions. After literally hours of bending, your hands and feet are very sore, but you tie the twine onto your newly crafted grappling hook. It's not great quality, but hopefully it will suffice. You carry your steel wire grappling hook over to the staircase and, holding tightly onto the end of the string, hurl the clip with all your might. The first time, you tossed it up and it slid back off, not catching anything. After a dozen more tries, the wire hooks catch something and you climb the rope up. Each stair seems to be made from two narrow planks of wood, and the hook caught between the planks. Great, one stair down, about fifty to go.
Your progress is very slow. Sometimes the hook catches on the first try, but often it takes at least thirty tosses for the hook to form any useful means of ascent. More than once the hook appeared to have caught, but upon trying to climb it the grappling hook came free, and you fell down. By the time you reach the top of the stairs, your arms and legs are burning, your hands are rope-burned, and your rear is sore from falling, but you've made it. The grappling hook is heavy and awkward to carry, so you decide to leave it here at the top of the stairs. There is a massive metal door in front of you, firmly sealed and most likely locked. You look around for an alternative exit, but find none. Still, through the tiny crack under the door you can smell fresh air. This door must lead outside. As you ponder your means of escape, you hear a click and the door opens, delivering a welcome blast of clean air. A man enters, most likely a handyman of some sort, carrying a toolbox. He grumbles something about a stupid machine, and you immediately seize the moment and leap out of the door, slipping out just before the door slams shut behind you. You look around and try to get your bearings.

WAAAAAAAAAHAAAAA!!" you squeeze your knees to your chest and begin to wail at the top of your small lungs, tears streaming out of your face and mingling with the slimy juices around you. 1111111111112221.content:
"R-Rachel?" you whisper.

"Sarah! Can you hear me!?"

"Y-yes?"

"oh thank god- What's wrong?! Are you hurt?"

"N-no?" You quaver, shocked both at the volume of your sister's voice, and at the urgency there... she actually sounds concerned.

"Can you move your arms and legs? um, ah, if it hurts even a little Do Not Force it!" The walls around you squeeze down slighty, and then freeze.

"oh shit SARAH! IS IT STUFFY IN THERE? shit! I mean REALLY STUFFY! HOW HARD IS IT TO BREATHE?!"

"F-fine?" Much to your surprise, it is easy to breathe. It's muggy, and very warm... but it never gets harder to breathe, like when you stick you head under the blankets. "Its... just warm..."

"Okay, okay..." Rachel takes a few deep breaths... you can hear the wooshing air like gusts from a far away cave. "Sarah, you need to move your arms and legs: Tell me if any of them hurt." The loud voice brooks no disobedience.

Hesitantly, you obey, stretching out your arms and legs, wiggling your toes and fingers.

"N-nothing hurts, Rachel."

"Are you Sure?" the voice booms, and you wince this time. instantly the walls around you twitch and squeeze at your body. "What was that?! What Happened?"

"Too loud!" You shout, covering your ears and squeesing your eyes shut.

"What do you mean too- oh..." Rachel takes another breath, and a much softer voice curls into your ears. "Is this better?"

"Much, yeah..."

"Okay... now, nothing hurts, and it isn't getting hard to breathe, right?" Rachel repeats firmly in a 'this is serious business and i'm really not playing around, seriously' tone of voice that you thought only Mom could get right.

"Y-yes... n-nothing hurts..."

"and?"

"a-and it isn't getting harder to breathe..." you finish, automatically.

"Good..." there is another long woosh of air as Rachel sighs in relief. "Wait... if you aren't hurt, then why were you crying?" she asks, cautious.

"... I... I..." The question makes the slimy darkness real again, the squeezing, the scrabbling... You curl in on yourself as the tears start again.

"y-you dropped me..." you whimper in the darkness, hugging your knees to your chest. "... I was crying and screaming not to let go and you dropped me!"
The tears come back full force as sobs wrack your tiny body.
"I was drowning and hurting and you dropped meeeee!" you wail again.

"Oh god Sarah, I'm so sorry-"

"NOOO!" you scream out, throwing all your fear into the anger. "NO! You're not Sorry! You just wanted to make fun of me with adult things and your Stupid adult toy and then leave me here alone!"

"I hate you!" you keep shouting, as Rachel's giant voice goes quiet "I hate you and I Hate adults and I hate being ALONE!"

"I hate being alone! I haaaahahaaaate beeeing aaaaloooooone..." you wail, the words breaking down into sobs and frightened, crushed tears that you're sure are lost in the gurgling, beating prison...

There's nothing here, in the dark forgotten and alone...

"You're not alone, Sarah."

"yesh ah mmmm..." you moan, holding your hands over your ears again.

"You're not alone, Sarah," that gentle, inescapable voice repeats, unrelenting. "I'm with you."

"No yer nooot..." you burble into your arms, "nobuhdy here buh me..."

"I'm here, Sarah. I'm with you, you're not alone."

"N where are you?!?" You shout, not caring and not looking up. "Ah can't see you!"

"I can't see you..." the voice murmurs gently, and the walls shift around you, softening and laying you back. "But I can feel you, Sarah. I can feel all of you... can't you feel me?" the warm, slimy fleshy gently rubs against your sides and back, soothing and rhythmic.

"I'm all around you, Sarah... You're not alone. I'm with you. I'm holding you..."
Something gently brushes the tip of your nose.
"Feel that, Sarah? On your nose? that's me..." the voice is soothing and earnest, calm and kind. "Everything you around you is me. I'm here with you...
you're not alone..."

"Not alone..." you murmur, as something pushes into your arms. You grip it and squeese it, burying your face in it as voice cradles you. "not alone..."

"Not alone." the voice agrees. "Not alone."

Rachel.

For a long while you simply lay there, holding your sister as she holds you.

"Feeling better?"

"mmf..." you nod, but don't release your sister's insides. The walls don't seem to mind.

"I'm sorry I scared you."

"s'okay."

"I'll take care of you. Until we figure this out. I promise."

"... nk's."

"No problem."

Nothing more really needs to be said.

"... 'm t-tired."

A gentle squeeze, a contented chuckle all around.

"Sleep tight sis."

Warmth. Wonderful warmth, and softness...

She hasn't called me sis in years... is your last thought before you drift off.

It's now 8:30 PM."

You were shocked, you've been asleep for the entire day. You felt a soft push against the walls as your bigger sister murred to herself. "Can you try to get me out of here?" You ask as you place your hands firmly against the ring of muscle hoping that it'd open up again and pull you out of your sisters depths and out just like it pulled you inside, only to be met with resistance by it. "My body and my own self are two separate things entirely, what I want to do, my own body cannot do it entirely. I want to get you out of my womb, but..." You start to hear your sister moaning to herself again as the slime began to build up around you. "...my body wants to keep you forever inside me." You hear Rachel stop moaning as the slime slowed to a stop around your ankles, "That slime stuff will help you out. I can't bring food to you through the normal way so you'll have to make do with it for now until I figure a way out." "But it's just yucky and icky, sis." you protest as you place a hand and touch the slimy goo, sticking to your hands and body as you star to slip against it. "I'm sorry, but it's all I got now," You heard Rachel regretfully say to you, "be lucky that I'm not dry now or you'd be starving later." Knowing that your sister is correct about this, you resign yourself and scoop up a handful of the goo and place it to your lips before drinking it. The slime was bitter as it oozed down your throat before settling in your tummy, and you were right it was yucky and icky beyond all previous belief, but it was regretfully the only meal your sister had to give for you, so you decided to just bear with the bad taste for now until you got out.

Eventually, your tummy was full of your sisters slime as she told you about what she did while you were asleep inside her. "I searched the internet for stuff about people randomly waking up shrunken to your size one day, and after filtering out the facts from the stories, I managed to find articles about an event that happened just a few years ago where an entire small town vanished, the town was still there, but half of its populace was gone: all of them gone overnight to boot. Than three years later, those missing people eventually returned again, saying that they were at a medical facility receiving treatments for a unique disease that re-emerged in the world again. I managed to find out about one of those patients, that he had recently moved close by to us, it's not the perfect plan, but it's all I could find with the short time we have." Rachel said that Mom had to go to an important business meeting for 4 days and wanted her to babysit you and Em in the meantime. Em had asked about what happened to you and said that you had went over to stay at a friends house but that she didn't know which one it was, giving you some time to find out about this disease from one of the patients.

"Ready to take a little trip kiddo?" You heard your sister ask you, detecting a hint of humor to her words as she said them.

You soon heard and felt your sister go down the stairs along with your sister Emma, after a few mild protests by your twin, Emma agrees to come along with Rachel; still unaware that you were there with her as well. A few steps and the creaking of the front door told you that Rachel and Emma were already out of the house as Rachel locked the front door before the two of them set off.

After spending what felt like eons clambering down from the bed, an exhausted, tiny Sarah was still a long ways away from finding help. After all, she and Em got to share the largest bedroom, and it was a respectable size even when she wasn't shrunken. At her current size, it might as well have been a vast ocean; the blue squishy carpet even added to the metaphor.

However, unless someone just happened across her - at this point she didn't really care who - it looked like she was going to have to make her own way across this 'ocean'.

After regaining her breath from practically abseiling down the bed, the two inch tall pre-teen began her hike across the floor. Her one solace was that the carpet was at least soft. Not all that comfortable, proving itchy against her sensitive skin, however it was at least soft, meaning her feet weren't to suffer too much.

Completely naked, exhausted, but thankfully warm because of the physical exertion she was putting herself through, Sarah fought her way across her bedroom once again. On several occasions she was sure she heard footsteps, only to convince herself otherwise. Because she would've seen them, should someone have walked past.

Thought having said that, it must've been two hours since her sister just left her on the bed in this state. And Rachel's room was right next to hers. Could her older sister have returned? If she had, that would explain the footsteps she thought she'd heard, and meant that maybe she wasn't going crazy after all!

Her energy slightly renewed at the thought of maybe convincing her sister to HELP her this time, Sarah sped up a little, and made a dash for the door. On the way however...

Pulling one arm out from underneath the covers, she said, "meet my girlfriend, Isabelle!"

Meanwhile, Sarah was at a crossroads. Isabelle obviously wanted to be saved - the pleading in her eyes was more than convincing enough - but just how would Sarah go about doing that? She couldn't exactly overpower her giantess older sister...

"Isabelle and I love each other SO much!" Rachel gushed, planting a kiss on the redhead's upper body, "ain't that right, sweetie?!"

Entering Rachel's stomach, you are greeted by a soft landing, courtesy of the half-digested lunch still sitting in there. Loud, booming sounds echo in the acid chamber, as the contents are moved around. You are helplessly thrown about in this mess.

"This is actually pretty neat," Em says, grabbing you by the torso between two fingers. She's not being very gentle.
"Hey, what are you doing?" you demand.
"So what is this, some sort of tiny robot?" Em asks. You now remember that Em is the most skeptical person you've ever known. She's not going to believe that you've been mysteriously cut down to under two inches.

1121222.content:
"No, you're not. My sister isn't an inch tall. You're just a fancy toy, and I'm going to prove it," Em decides. You feel a chill go down your spine, and you fear what Em might have in mind as "proof." Still holding you in her left hand, she takes the half-full glass of water on her bedside table and lifts it up. You can see your distorted reflection in the curved glass.
"Robots are electric, and electric toys stop working in water," Em explains as she drops you into the glass. You plunge into the liquid and, after regaining your bearings, you swim your way back to the surface. The water isn't cold, as it's been sitting out all night, but your sodden clothes weigh you down and constrict your movement as you tread water.
"Em! I'm not a robot! I'm not going to short circuit, I'm going to drown!" you shout. The water pressure on your lungs makes shouting a laborious process, and for a moment your head spins as your shouting deprives your muscles of much-needed oxygen.
"If you're really Sarah, you should be good at swimming. Stay there for a little while," Em says. She takes out her smartphone and unlocks it, and begins to type on it. You're rapidly becoming exhausted. You weren't ready for this, and you're running out of steam. You tread water for about two minutes before your arms and legs begin to ache with the effort of continuing to stay afloat.
"Em, please, I can't do this much longer," you gasp, hoping she'll hear you. She does seem to notice, and she looks down at you in the glass.
What does Em do?

11212221.content:
"Not working so well in the water, robot?" Em gloats, grinning smugly at your suffering.
"I'm... not... a robot," you pant.
"I'll let you out if you can stay there for another five minutes," Em says. Five more minutes? You've barely made it two. Em seriously overestimates your swimming ability. You were decent in a bathing suit, but your shirt and pants were weighing you down and catching the water, making your movements slow and labored.
Time seems to slow down as you run out of energy. It seems like an eternity passes, but in reality you only last about thirty seconds before you start to sink. Your head dips below the surface of the clear water. Your view of Em grows distorted and dim as your last lungful of oxygen begins to run out. You feebly try to swim back to the surface, but you can barely slow your descent. You are sinking further and further, and you feel your back hit the bottom of the glass. Bubbles of spent air trickle from your mouth, and within moments your lungs are empty. For a few agonizing moments, you lie at the bottom of the glass, your lungs empty and your mind torn between the need to inhale and the knowledge that there was no air to be had. Finally, you can't take it anymore and, ignoring your primal, anti-drowning instinct, you gasp. Water fills your lungs, and you black out.
Is this the end of Sarah's journey?

Em laughs at the robot that only lasted a few minutes in the cup of water. Em had seen Sarah stay afloat for ten minutes at the pool. Em reached her hand into the glass and took out the limp, broken toy. Maybe it had been overly hasty of her to try to destroy it. The robot was pretty sophisticated, even if it was remote controlled. Water trickled from the miniature girl's mouth, much more liquid than would have fit inside her mouth alone, but the damage had been done. "You can come out now, Sarah," Em called. Where had Sarah been hiding? She might be in the room, watching the encounter unfold and reacting with a remote control, but it seemed more likely that she was somewhere farther away. The robot had been talking, which meant that Sarah was probably talking into it, and Em hadn't heard her voice from anywhere else in the room. The robot probably had a camera in its eyes or something.
Taking a magnifying glass from her desk, Em examined the broken robot's face. It really did look a lot like Sarah, admittedly. The eyes were closed, but when she used a toothpick to carefully pull back one eyelid, the eye beneath was dull and glassy. It could totally be a camera. 11221122211221.content:
As you pull yourself out of the water, you brush your sodden bangs away from your eyes and survey the scene. You are in a tame jungle of grass, each blade as tall as you are, which makes it difficult to see much, but it would be impossible to miss one aspect. Your older sister, Rachel, is sitting cross-legged in the grass by the pond. You hadn't seen her before, so she must have just come out while you were inside the fish's belly. You'd have to remember to thank her for the knife once you get back to normal. Realizing that she might be the best way to get help, you approach her, pushing your way through the thick greenery.
Rachel is barefoot and wearing a t-shirt and a long skirt that comes down to her knees. It sits loosely on her, so the folds of the cloth cover her undergarments despite her immodest pose. As you get closer, you see that her eyes are closed, and you remember that she's been fascinated with the idea of meditation lately. Rachel had a habit of picking up random bits of culture like that. Two weeks ago it was yoga. Three weeks before that, it was Krav Maga. She generally abandoned them within a month. Anyway, you know that you'll have a bit of a task ahead of you if you want to get Rachel's attention. For a split second you consider tickling her feet, but you remember how poorly that turned out when you tried it on Em and put the thought out of your head. You're going to need to get to a better vantage point, and that means you need higher ground. You see two solid options for getting up to get her attention. You can either try to climb up Rachel's body to get closer to her ear, although if she feels you she might just brush you away without even opening her eyes, or you can climb into a nearby bush and jump out onto her.

1122112221122122.content:
Unknown to you, a predator stalks you in the shadows. A long, muscular body covered in green, white, and yellow lengthwise stripes of smooth scales slithers silently toward you. You hear a faint noise as a wood chip is disturbed and clicks against another small wooden pellet, and you turn to investigate. A mere six inches away from you is an eighteen inch long garter snake, eyeing you and flicking its tongue in and out as it slides across the ground toward you. You freeze. You're pretty sure snakes can't see you if you don't move. Or was that Tyrannosaurus Rex? You're pretty sure it's snakes. It slithers up to you, flicking its tongue out close enough that you can feel the air moving around its forked tongue. Sure enough, it stops next to you, apparently unable to detect your presence.
"What now?" you wonder to yourself. If it can't see you, that's great, but you won't be able to escape--
Your train of thought is cut off as it suddenly bites, enveloping your right foot in its mouth. The saliva is sticky and viscous, much thicker than anything you experienced in the koi's stomach, and the snake has already unhinged its jaw in anticipation of its meal. You scream and try to pull your leg free, but as you do so it scrapes against something sharp at the back of the snake's mouth. You feel a stinging pain, like a bee's sting, in your right foot, and it begins to go numb. It feels like your foot has fallen asleep, but the sensation is spreading up your leg. You grasp at a root on the ground and try to pull yourself out of the snake's mouth, but it shifts slightly and envelops your other foot in its hungry maw as well. Another prick, and now both feet are numb and useless. The tingling in your right leg has spread up to your knee, and you can no longer bend it properly. You have barely any control over your own leg, and the sensation continues to spread. It's venom, you realize. You thought garter snakes weren't venomous, but apparently you were mistaken.
The venom spreads quickly up your leg and into your torso. You feel your rapid pulse slow down, and against your will your breathing slows as well. Your screams also end, as you can no longer muster the lung strength to cry out. Instead you whimper and sob pathetically as the numbness reaches your arms and neck. Your elbows lock, and then your fingers swell, compromising your grip on the root.
Now that you are fully paralyzed, the snake continues to progress up your legs. It takes its time--it knows you're not going anywhere. It slides up to your knees, then your waist. You try to struggle, try to do anything, but your traitorous body won't move. All you can manage is feeble little kicks and the like. You can barely even twitch your fingers. You are engulfed up to the chest now, and the reality of the situation is beginning to really sink in. There is no escape from this. You had been lucky enough before to be able to move around in order to escape the fish, but nothing short of divine intervention would save you here.
The snake's maw slides up to the base of your neck. You can see light glinting off the saliva-slicked gums and tiny, horribly venomous fangs. You try to open your mouth to cry out, but your jaw is locked shut by the paralytic poison. Then, with another gulp, it reaches your chin. You can't even feel the slimy saliva covering your neck and jaw, but you can see it, stretched out like a film of soap between the snake's mouth and your face. With the next gulp you are enveloped up to the nose, and you take the biggest breath you can before with another mighty gulp it swallows your entire head. Only your hands remain outside of the snake's mouth now, and with a couple more gulps it finishes the job. Having swallowed its prey, the snake reattaches its jaw and moves on, hoping to get some sun while it digests.
A tiny bit of light filters through the skin and muscle of the snake, and you can see the pink, undulating flesh that moves you further down into the depths of the snake's stomach. You still can't move. You can't even close your eyes. Gastric juices leak from the walls, and your clothes begin to lose their integrity. Shortly, your shirt has been burned away, along with your pants and underpants. Although the rubber soles of your shoes are intact, the cloth binding them to your feet burns away, leaving you barefoot as well.
You know only a miracle will save you. Are you in luck?
1122112221122122.title: Just a common garter snake... uh oh...

11221122211221221.content:
Rachel was having trouble getting into the right mindset today. A looming science project kept forcing itself into her mind and tearing her away from her meditation. She was supposed to find a specimen for dissection to bring into school that day, and she hadn't been able to find anything. She knew that some frogs lived in the koi pond, but she hadn't been able to find any at all. At this point, the odds of her being able to complete the assignment were slim.
She opened her eyes and regained her bearings. Everything seemed fairly normal, apart from the F in biology that loomed over her. Suddenly, something caught her eye. A long, green shape was stretched out on a flat rock near her, right next to a bush. A snake! A common garter snake. It looked like it had recently eaten, so it wouldn't be as agile as before. Rachel pitied the poor frog that had been swallowed, but this was a godsend. A snake would work for a dissection specimen. Careful not to attract attention, Rachel crawled silently toward the snake. She wished she had her knife, but she couldn't remember where it had ended up. She wasn't sure if Sarah had given it back after she borrowed it. Oh well, a cruder method would suffice this time. She pounced at the snake and managed to grab it just above the lump in its belly. Success! As the snake writhed in an attempt to escape, she managed to grab it by the head, pinching its jaw shut as she did so to avoid being bitten. Rachel knew that garter snake venom wasn't fatal to humans, but it would hurt like a bee sting and could cause numbness and stiffness in the bitten area. Sliding both her hands to be right by its head, Rachel twisted both hands in opposite directions, snapping the snake's neck. After a single, final struggle, the snake went still. Rachel ran back inside, careful to avoid stepping on any sharp stones or wood chips, and got a large freezer bag to put the dead snake in to avoid its... fluids... from getting all over the place. She carefully put the snake in her bag, then put her shoes on and ran to catch the bus.
Getting on the bus, Rachel sat next to her friend Jenny. Jenny was a girl in Rachel's grade with shoulder-length, wavy orange hair and a bright smile. She was really naive and had a heart of gold, and although she wasn't really a "popular girl," she was friends with just about everyone in school. Rachel doubted that Jenny would have been able to bring herself to kill an animal for the science project. In fact, what kind of school made the kids get their own animals to dissect? How low was the school's science budget anyway?
"Good morning, Rachel," Jenny said pleasantly.
"Yes it is!" Rachel replied happily.
"You seem particularly chipper this morning."
"Yep! I just found a specimen for dissection," Rachel gloated. Jenny seemed sad.
"Oh, that's good I guess. I didn't get anything, I guess one bad grade isn't too bad," she said gloomily.
"Don't worry, we can be lab partners. I found this big ol' snake in my yard this morning, we can dissect it together. It'll be fun!" Rachel said. The look on Jenny's face seemed to say "I don't think tearing apart a corpse is fun, but I appreciate the kind offer."
"Thanks," Jenny said.
Biology was the second class of the day, after algebra. Algebra sucked. Nobody liked it, why did they have to teach it? No job application was going to ask her to find x. Rachel was excitedly looking forward to her next class, so the math class dragged on and on.
11221122211221221.title: School science project (Rachel POV)

112211222112212211.content:
Finally, after what seemed like days, the bell rang, and the hell that was algebra came to an end. Rachel got up from her seat and hurried--or hurried as much as one can in a hall shared with hundreds of students of various ages--to her biology classroom. The biology teacher was an eccentric lady named Miss Perry, who was a tall beanpole of a woman. She wore a white labcoat and goggles today, which was normal for any day that they'd be doing anything hands-on.
Once the class had assembled, she began the lesson.
"Good morning everyone. I trust that you've all brought in samples for dissection today?" she said. Most of the students brought out some sort of creature from their bags, Rachel producing the dead snake. Jenny wasn't the only girl who hadn't brought anything: four girls and three boys had come empty-handed.
"Excellent. Please raise your hand if you didn't bring anything," Miss Perry said. The seven students, Jenny included, raised their hands.
"I must say I'm disappointed in you. You'll be losing half credit for today's lesson--" she began. Rachel raised her hand and interrupted by calling the teacher's name.
"Yes, Rachel?"
"Can't the people who didn't get anything pair up with people who did?" Rachel asked.
"No. There will be no lab partners in this exercise, everyone will be doing it alone. If you do not have anything to dissect, you can come collect an owl pellet to pull apart for half credit. Everyone else, find a lab space and put on your gloves, apron, and goggles. Safety first!" the teacher said. Rachel felt bad for Jenny, but at least she would be able to get some credit without feeling guilty about killing something.
Most of the students had come in with a frog or toad. Rachel and one of the boys had found snakes, and two students had mice. One girl had a foot-long rat.
Rachel opened up the dissection guide to the section on snakes and began with the process. First, she used the small steel scissors to snip away the skin, then used pins to hold the skin back. She referred back to the page on the snake's internal anatomy, first seeing the trachea, then the heart, then the lungs, then the liver, then the stomach--
Rachel froze, astonished. The snake's stomach had twitched ever so slightly. Had she imagined it? Again, it moved! Going off the guide, Rachel took the scalpel and carefully slit along the length of the stomach. Where she had expected to see a half-dead frog, out slid a naked, inch and a half tall female doll. No, wait. If it was a doll it wouldn't have been moving. Could it be real? Pinching a ball of cotton with her tweezers, Rachel dabbed the mucus and digestive juices from the girl's body, leaving her somewhat sticky but more safe than before. The girl shifted her head, moving it from one side to the other. Rachel, looking closely with a magnifying glass, realized that the girl was breathing--and recognized the face. The hair was uneven and had been somewhat burned away, but it was definitely either Em or Sarah. How she had ended up an inch and a half tall inside a snake's stomach was a total mystery, but Rachel was willing to go with it for now.
"What's that?" Jenny asked. Rachel jumped. Jenny had come up behind her and was looking at Sarah over Rachel's shoulder. Instinctively, Rachel covered the girl with her hand.
"It's nothing," Rachel denied.
"It's not nothing, come on, you can tell me," Jenny said.
"I can't tell you here. Meet me by the bathroom as soon as we get out of this class," Rachel said. She was willing to trust Jenny with this, but Miss Perry was unhinged enough that she might decide to dissect the tiny girl if she knew about it. Jenny nodded and went to the teacher. After speaking for a few moments, Jenny grabbed her bag, nodded to Rachel, and left the room. She must have been released early after finishing her dissection.
Glancing around to make sure she wasn't being watched, Rachel grabbed her diminutive sister and was about to put her in a pocket when she realized that she didn't have pockets on this skirt. Her bag wasn't on hand, and it would be very conspicuous if she went to her bag. Worse, the teacher was making rounds, checking on students, and Rachel was next. Rachel needed to act fast. She glanced around, then shoved the tiny girl into...
112211222112212211.title: Biology class (Rachel POV)

1122112221122122112.content:
Seeing no safer alternative, Rachel deposited the tiny girl between her breasts. The small form was still somewhat slimy and was moving ever so slightly, which made it very distracting. It was like having a worm in her cleavage.
"Everything going alright over here?" Miss Perry asked.
"Yes, it's fine. I'm almost done," Rachel said.
"Very good. Once you've finished and cleaned up, you can leave."
Rachel had never worked so fast in biology before. Within eight minutes, she had completed the dissection, taken notes, and cleaned her work space. Then, she ran off to find Jenny. Sure enough, Jenny was waiting by the bathroom, just as they had agreed.
"So what was that thing?" Jenny asked. Rachel reached into her cleavage, grabbed the body, and produced it for Jenny to see.
"Look," she said.

112211222112212212.content:
After the snake had stopped moving, you were sure your life was over. Your clothes had already been torn away, you were still paralyzed by the venom, and your skin was starting to itch. Suddenly, there was motion again. The snake was writhing, moving wildly and frantically, and then all at once, it went still. Totally still. You could not longer feel the stomach squeezing you, and the heartbeat had gone silent. Something had killed the snake, but that wouldn't necessarily do you any good. What killed snakes? Big birds, you suppose. Other snakes. Badgers? Did badgers live in this area? Whatever it was, it was probably going to eat the snake, and you would die anyway.
Since the snake's death, acids had stopped leaking in through the walls, and those acids already present had seeped further down into the digestive system, leaving only trace amounts on you. Still, that was enough to irritate your skin and leave you very uncomfortable. You start to cry, wishing that this would just end.
As you had expected, the body of the snake did not lie still. There was motion of all sorts, some gentle, some jarring. Still unable to move or even see, you were helpless and unable to brace against the impacts. Then, for what seemed like forever (although was in reality just an hour), everything was still. During that time, the itching turned into a mild burn, like you were submerged in a bath that was just too warm, but the poison also wore off to a degree. You were still virtually immobile, but instead of being totally paralyzed, you were just very stiff.
Suddenly, there was another period of rapid motion, and then stillness, and then there was a sudden change. Light started to filter through one side of the stomach, and you could hear the sounds of people. The remaining wall of flesh made it hard to make out the exact words, but it was definitely humans. You muster all your strength into your struggles, hoping to be noticed before the acids start to do some real damage. Then, an enormous, sharp, metal blade slices through the stomach wall. You just manage to avoid the slicing edge as it slits the snake's belly open, and you slide out of its body onto a table. Looking up, you see your older sister Rachel, wearing safety goggles, rubber gloves, and an apron, holding a scalpel and looking down at you quite in shock.
Someone is approaching Rachel. Do they spot you?

You watch as a big bite of pizza enters this girl's mouth, then the slice returns to its place shortly after, a big gash present in the front. You move to the edge of the tray as the girl chews and talks to the boy you came here with.

Just as you're about to climb the lip of the tray and set foot on the table, the girl jumps in excitement over something said and jostles the tray, sending the side you were climbing up slightly into the air and then just as quickly, it comes back down. Without you.
12111221.title: The girl's lunch tray

121112212.content:
"No no no no no no no no!!" You yell as you fall back down from the girl's bumping of the tray, right on to her half-eaten pizza slice.

The girl stomach growls, ready to digest the rest of her lunch. Whilst talking to the boy you arrived here with, she picks up the slice and brings it up to her mouth. Since she was not looking, you were not noticed, and entered her mouth. The girl chomps down, separating the bite you're with from what remains of the slice, and begins to chew with her mouth open, in between words. Her voice rattles your eardrums with its sheer exaggerated volume, due to your size. Luckily, you escape being chewed, but of course this means...

After a short round of chewing the pizza and coating you in saliva, the girl swallows her mouthful, and you are sent into her throat, which passes you down into her stomach with rhythmic contractions and pulses. Once you do plop into her belly, you immediately struggle to breathe and almost gag on the humid "air." Her stomach gives you little time to find your footing, always rumbling and moving about as it begins digestion.

Outside, the girl interrupts her friends as they talk, "Hang on guys, I gotta burp," and lets out a tremendous loud belch. "Haha, that feels better." Is her way of saying "excuse me."

That burp shook you off your feet and into the thick of it, right into the digesting mush of pizza. Are you stuck?
121112212.title: On the pizza

choices: The girl takes a gulp of a drink, loosening your bond
The girl burps again, this doesn't do any good for you
1211122121.content:
Regaining your balance after being sent back flying, you start to struggle to stand up, but your body barely moves, being pulled down by a new hindrance...the digesting remains of this girl's lunch. Oh crap! If you can't move, you're powerless against the wrath of digestion. The girl's belly gurgles loudly, and swishes the contents around, giving you a small splash of stomach acid. It immediately stings your body like hell, and you try again to escape the hold you're in, but to no avail.

Suddenly...
1211122121.title: What luck...
