"Sweet burp." One of the boys at the lunch table comments to the girl.

"Thanks, but I can do better." She proceeds to grab her soda and chug most of it, intent on proving herself.

Several gulps of fizzy drink splash down hard into her stomach, right on top of you. In the torrent of soda, the bond that the digesting slop of used-to-be-food has on you releases, and you are washed away, into a brief and painful mixing with stomach acid, and then back out to the farther edges of this girl's stomach cavern. You catch your breath, exhausted and wincing with pain just from two slight contacts with the acid. Needless to say, you definitely want to get out of here.

You watch as the girl's stomach reacts to the massive sudden influx of carbon dioxide. It makes all sorts of weird loud noises, moving about and expanding, readying to expel this excess pressure taking up room in her tummy. Bubbles arise from the pool of acid, soda, and chewed-up food as well, as all of that gas is pushed back out.

"Watch this!" The young girl announces, before releasing a huge, long and loud pizza-and-soda-smelling burp. The whole table cracks up in laughter and cheers at this girl's loudest belch ever. She laughs too, and bows proudly for her accomplishment.

Inside, you are...
12111221211.title: The girl takes a gulp of a drink

choices: You try to take advantage of the situation and make Nicole sick
121112212111.content:
Unfortunately for you, that huge burp did not carry you out of this girl's belly. Instead, you were blown back with such a great force that you slammed into the wall of her stomach. You flop to the (thankfully dry) floor below you, in great pain from your flight.

"Ow, some of my food just smacked against my tummy." The girl thought to herself. She patted her flat belly in response. Her doing so rolled you into the pool of digesting lunch and acid!!

You immediately scream out in intense pain and scramble back to the safe spot, your clothes slowly disintegrating right before your eyes as globs of acid eat away at them. You feel your skin still burning, but luckily your clothing got the brunt of the acids. The girl's stomach shakes violently as a deep rumbling echoes, and her digesting lunch begins churning about. Soon, you may very well be mixed in with it.

"Ugh, my stomach hurts now..." The girl moans as she feels her belly rumbling. The boy next to her turns his head, "Hey Nicole, what's wrong? Too much soda?"

She responds "Yeah, I think so..." and burps quietly inside her mouth, blowing the escaping air in the boy's direction.

"Jeez, what did you eat?" The boy moves his head back, disgusted.

Nicole's stomach groans once more, churning the pizza and soda together. Your safe spot is being encroached upon as acid and food sludge is fast approaching. What do you do?
121112212111.title: Shaken up and moved around

1211122121111.content:
There is no hope for you; the oncoming mixture corners you. You start to cry, knowing that you are about to die, and inside a girl about your age no less. Maybe if you weren't shrunken and a part of her lunch, you could've been friends, you think.

Nicole's stomach rumbles deeply, and her lunch overtakes you. You fall from the rumbling, and one of your shoes falls off before you are engulfed. The sheer pain attacks your entire body for a few seconds, until you pass out. The mush churns around for a bit, and then finally settles.

"Ahh, I'm feeling a bit better. Thanks for askin', I think you helped!" Nicole says playfully to the boy, who regards her awkwardly now, since she basically burped in his face.

Later that day, as she is walking home, Nicole suddenly belches lightly, and your shoe (what's left of it anyway) flies out of her mouth. She picks up off the ground and looks at it curiously.

"Is that a...sneaker?" She wonders, quickly deciding that she is crazy and it's probably just some weird bit that school lunch pizzas have. She tosses it aside and continues to go home.
1211122121111.title: No escape, bye Sarah

choices: Try and make Nicole sick since she's burping so much
12111221212.content:
Outside, the girl drinks some more soda.

"Hey Nicole, did you do the homework for math?" A girl across the table asks of the girl you are currently digesting inside of.

"Nah, it was way too hard." Nicole replies. Afterwards, she burps quietly in her mouth, blowing out the hot air as each burp comes up her throat. Between your thrashing around and Nicole's eating, a lot of air is being released.

"Ugh, pizza is so good but it makes me so burpy." Nicole complains. The boy next to her turns to face her and agrees, but he quickly realizes his mistake as Nicole turns toward him and ends up burping loudly again.

"...Yours are way better than mine though." He says, involuntarily taking in the smell of Nicole's stomach.

"Haha, thanks." Nicole feels proud so she doesn't apologize.

This is hopeless, you think. If Nicole keeps burping than air will be gone faster than you will digest! You have to think fast.
12111221212.title: The girl burps again

choices: You are successful! Nicole expels you from her stomach.
121112212121.content:
You begin to pound at the walls with renewed vigor as panic forces you to take action. You hear Nicole groan.
"Ooh, I don't feel so good," your unwitting captor complains.
"You did eat a lot of pizza," the boy points out. There is a mighty rumbling from within the stomach, and...
121112212121.title: A moment of weakness?

1211122121212.content:
Nicole's stomach, bloated with mounds of pizza, soda, and swallowed air, groaned loudly under her shirt. Unfortunately for the concerned boy, Nicole unleashes a powerful, bubbly, and booming burp right in his direction. The mixing smells of the skinny girl's digesting lunch flew past his face.

"Ahh...I feel better now." Nicole giggled. The boy had since got up and left!

Are you still alive in there?
1211122121212.title: She just burps again.

choices: At the start of Nicole's large intestine--still a long way to go.
12111221212123.content:
The belching no longer effects you, because you are no longer in Nicole's belly.
As you were pounding on her stomach walls, you didn't realize it, but you were striking a very particular place on the organ's wall: her pyloric sphincter. Sobbing with fear as you blindly attacked her stomach, you were surprised when the valve opened. The chyme inside the stomach pushes you through the opening, which shuts behind you. You, along with about your body size of half-digested food, slide into Nicole's duodenum. Air is hard to find here, but to your surprise, that doesn't seem to be bothering you very much. Somehow you always manage to get enough air.
The walls of this narrow tunnel are slimy and textured, with leaf-like protrusions covered in mucus making it hard to really maneuver effectively. The mush that came from the stomach with you wastes little time passing through your current area, but you aren't making such rapid progress. Due to your size, and the fact that you were still totally solid, you weren't able to move as rapidly through. You note that your clothes, already torn and weakened by digestive acids, slip off of you as you are coated in thick slime. The tattered remains of your garments go on without you.
Realizing that you won't go any further without pushing on your own, you briefly consider trying to go back into the stomach. You aren't sure what awaits you down below, but it can't be good. Still, you realize that the body is designed not to let anything back into the stomach from here, and you don't seem to be burning in acid where you are. You won't be able to stay here forever, obviously, so your best option is to go with the flow. Wriggling like a worm, you slide around a bend into the next part of Nicole's intestines.
The texture of the walls is different here. Where the protrusions on the walls before had been like slimy leaves, here the walls were more like a thousand tiny fingers. They were also covered in mucus, but not as much as before. The protrusions moved in undulating waves, slowly pushing you along, but due to your size and solidness you make little progress before you begin to crawl again. Even still, progress is slow. You can't get a grip on anything, so while you push yourself forward a little bit, your arms slide back as you crawl. A snail's pace would have been fast by comparison.
After a half hour of your slow crawl, the walls gradually change again. The tiny, slimy fingers become even smaller, and your progress all but halts. You can't force yourself to crawl any farther because you have no traction at all. The only progress you make is the very slow inching along that you make thanks to the waves of digestive motion. Realizing that you're not making any useful difference, you go limp and rest. Your arms had been aching from the crawling, and your lungs, somehow not yet starved completely of oxygen, were still struggling to find enough. Eventually, you slip into unconsciousness.
Where do you wake up?
12111221212123.title: Moving along quickly now.

choices: When do things ever go your way?
Nicole drops some kids off at the pool... somewhat literally.
121112212121232.content:
You are awoken by your head hitting something and bending your neck painfully for a moment. As you straighten yourself back out, you are struck by a horrible odor, as if you had put your nose right against someone's butt while they were farting. You gag at the overwhelming stench of methane as you try to get your bearings.
Unlike previously, in Nicole's stomach and small intestines, you were fairly dry. You're dizzy and your throat is parched. The walls of the area were still slick and slimy, but not nearly as much as previously. You could feel the slippery, smooth flesh beneath the layer of mucus.
You get your bearings. You are in a U-shaped portion of intestine. You just came out of one side, so you know that the other side must be the way forward. You take some time to reorient yourself, which is made more difficult by the slick floor and walls, but you manage to position yourself correctly. With a desperate leap, you jump up into the end of the U that you didn't come from. Fortunately, you don't need to defy gravity for long, as the tunnel bends sharply downward after the initial rise. You clamber over the apex and fall a short distance onto a soft floor that smells... well it doesn't take a doctor to figure out that it's poop. The solid turd blocks your path forward, and when you landed your feet sunk far enough into it that you can't just pull them back out. With nothing to grip except the mirror-smooth, mucus-slicked walls of Nicole's rectum, you are trapped up to your ankles in fresh fecal matter. You try to push off the floor to free your feet, but you stop quickly when your hands start to sink into the floor as well. You stand up, but when Nicole moves you fall down onto your rear. Standing seems inadvisable in your current situation, and your butt doesn't seem to sink too much into the ground, so you remain seated, trying in vain to pull your feet free.
Does something else unfortunate happen before you can get out?
121112212121232.title: Inside Nicole's rectum--freedom is imminent!

1211122121212321.content: You are patiently waiting for your freedom, when you feel a change in the air pressure--or rather gas pressure, since most of what you're inhaling is farts. You can't see anything to determine what's happening, but Nicole doesn't seem to be moving, so you stand up and feel around. The walls seem normal, but when you reach up, your heart stops. There's a ceiling now. Another log of feces, more solid than the one you're currently stuck in, has moved into position above your head and is slowly bearing down upon you. Terrified, you push against it, trying to ward it off, but its progress continues unimpeded. Rather than pushing it upward, it pushes you downward, and you sink up to your knees in the ground. Like the trash compactor in that one Star Wars scene, the ceiling inexorably pushes you deeper into the turd below. You sink up to your crotch, then up to your hips, and then your armpits, when...
1211122121212321.title: Between a poop and a hard place.

12111221212123212.content:
You continue pressing up against the ceiling, but as it continues to push you down you realize that your efforts are useless. You sink up to your armpits, and your arms come down and sink in to the elbows. Your hands are just over your head, pushing with as much force as they can, but you sink up to your neck, then your chin, and you take one last breath before your head is submerged as well.
Unlike before when you could inexplicably find air within Nicole's intestines, you are suffocating here. The two poops have joined, sealing you completely in vile, squishy matter that fills your nostrils and mouth as you gasp for oxygen where there is none to be found. The abhorrent taste of shit fills your mouth and you gag as your head spins from oxygen starvation. You fade into unconsciousness, so close to freedom yet so far away, suffocated inside of turds larger than your body.
12111221212123212.title: A bad end in a rear end.

1211122121212322.content: Suddenly, the walls tremble, then squeeze together, deforming the ground you stand on and pushing it downward. You hear Nicole grunting, and you know exactly what's about to happen, but then suddenly realize that you have no plan. If you get pooped out into the toilet, you'll be flushed, and you don't think you could survive that. Instead, you brace your hands against the constricting walls, trying to remain inside Nicole's ass for as long as possible. You have one shot at surviving, and that's staying in here through the entirety of her bowel movement. The walls of Nicole's rectum press on you, giving you a chance to stay here, but the floor is dropping away rapidly and the walls are slick and slimy. Do you get carried out with the poop, or stay inside her?
1211122121212322.title: Dropping a kid off at the pool

choices: Notices something treading water in the toilet
12111221212123221.content:
You can't manage to get enough grip to change your fate, and the poop carries you down with it into the toilet like cement shoes. Fortunately, the impact with the water is enough to knock you free from the turd, and you start treading water inside the toilet. You hear Nicole sigh with relief, and you are about to start swimming for the side of the toilet bowl when you glance up, just in time to see a stream of hot, yellow liquid pour down directly onto you. The force of the urine knocks you underwater and pushes the air from your lungs. You surface, gasping for breath, only to be knocked under by another turd. You're getting some pretty shitty luck with Nicole's accidental aim. The poop pushes you deep beneath the surface of the toilet, discombobulating you and destroying your sense of direction. You try to look around to gain your bearings, but the yellow water stings your eyes. You use gravity to figure out which way is up, and swim up again. You take a deep gasp of air, and manage to dodge a wad of used toilet paper that splashes down next to you.
Then, Nicole stands up, pulls up her pants, and...
12111221212123221.title: Splashdown in the toilet

121112212121232211.content: Nicole looked in the toilet to see something moving. She used toilet paper to fish it out. What did she see?
121112212121232211.title: Is that a bug?

121112212121232212.content: You stare in horrified silence as she reaches for the tiny silver lever and pushes it. With a mighty roar, your calm pond turns into a murderous whirlpool, and you are swept up in the powerful current. Everything spins around, slowly at first, then faster and faster until finally you are forced underwater. The current pushes you down, then up, then down again, but you don't know what happened after that. You crack your head on the side of a pipe and lose consciousness, only to drown unceremoniously in the plumbing.
121112212121232212.title: Flushed.

12111221212123222.content:
While the poop is forced downward, you brace yourself for the worst. If you don't manage to stay in here, you'll be flushed. Your life is at stake and you don't intend to lose. Suddenly, your fecal floor's slow, steady descent turns into a rapid drop, and you start to fall with it, but a few inches down you are stopped by something clutching you around the waist. Nicole's anus has clenched around you, and gravity has freed you from the poop. Thinking quickly, you hoist yourself back inside her rectum, just in time, as you see just before the sphincter closes a white flash of toilet paper. Getting wiped would have made your efforts so far pointless. You wait for her to stand up, and plan your escape. You try to push against the tight aperture, but to no avail. The sphincter is incredibly strong. You hear Nicole speak.
"What, I have to go again?" she wonder aloud, and she sits back down. You immediately stop pushing on her anus, just as it relaxes and the walls squeeze you. You, fortunately, aren't quite forced out. You're not the right shape to be so easily pushed around, although it is a challenge keeping yourself inside. She wipes again and stands up. You're going to need to rethink your strategy. She'll probably relax once she's asleep, or you could try to slip out next time she farts.
12111221212123222.title: You cling on and stay inside her ass

choices: Leave Nicole's panties and hope no one catches you.
Stay inside Nicole's panties until she is alone.
121112212121232221.content:
Getting pooped out will get you flushed and being wiped will most likely get you similar results so you decide to wait for the chance to leave your confinement in another way. You lay just by the anus from inside for a while as you suffer through the terrible stench and are often shaken with each of Nicole's movements.

More solid waste ends up in the tunnel and pushes against you, much to your disgust. You try not to cry as you reflect on your situation before the nearby fleshy door starts to quiver and you realise Nicole is about to fart. You push against your exit and manage, with the help of the fart pressure, to force it open and you are thrown out of Nicole's butt and against the seat of her panties forcefully with a loud: *Prrraaaarrp*

"Nicole!" You hear a mature female voice and realise Nicole is already at her house which is unfamiliar to you. "Oopsie..." You hear Nicole's voice in response with a full mouth and you could also deduce that they are having dinner.

Do you:
121112212121232221.title: Sneaky and squeaky

choices: He gives you to the teacher
12112.content:
The boy hurries down the hallway, and then turns into a door on the right. He goes up to one of the small chairs with built-in desks and sits in it. You rest on top of his foot for a few moments as you catch your breath, but when you look up you see him looking back down at you. You freeze, terrified, as the boy reaches down and grabs you. He looks confused, but not confused enough to have realized that you're alive. He must think you're a doll that got tangled up in his shoelace. He quickly opens his desk, tosses you inside, and closes it. As he tosses you in, you hit your head hard on something made of metal and you black out.

Your consciousness returns gradually. First comes your hearing. You hear garbled and distant words:
"...And so if you carry the one, we have fifty-two plus ten, which is sixty-two."
Next your sight returns, blurred and distorted at first. You're definitely not inside the desk anymore, you can see the rectangular panels that make up the ceiling. Finally, your sense of feeling comes back, and you realize that you are being held. The boy is holding you by your wrists and making you dance around like some sort of living puppet. You see that the boy is using his math book as a barrier so that the teacher can't see what he's doing. You try to call to him, but you can't seem to muster the ability to speak. Your voice comes out as a wheeze that is totally drowned out by the teacher droning on about addition. You can't move your arms at all, and your kicking doesn't really look much different than limp flailing. Your head is still throbbing painfully.
"Jeremy? Are you paying attention?" comes the teacher's voice. The boy looks up, startled, and his hands freeze.
"I asked you a question, Jeremy."
"What was the question again?" the boy, presumably named Jeremy, asks. The teacher sighs.
"Never mind. I'll ask someone who was listening to me. Bear in mind that this will be on your next quiz, Jeremy, you're only hurting yourself by ignoring class."
Jeremy was apparently quite badly spooked by the experience, so he starts playing with you much more hesitantly, shooting furtive glances down at you while maintaining his gaze passively on the chalkboard.
"Yes, Katie?" the teacher said at one point, apparently calling on the girl behind and to the right of Jeremy.
"Jeremy's playing with dolls in class," Katie said. What a tattletale.
"That might help explain his lack of focus. Show me the toy, Jeremy."
What does Jeremy do?
12112.title: Bored in math class

choices: Inside the cover of the notebook
121122.content:
Jeremy quickly unzips his backpack and stuffs you inside. You are launched directly to the bottom of the nearly empty bag, and you land hard. The cloth bottom barely cushions your impact, so the landing is only slightly less painful than being blasted against the linoleum tile. You bounce once and lie still, dazed.
"Sorry, miss, I'll put it away," Jeremy said. You rub your head and sit up, sore and aching. A notebook towers over you on one side, and a hard plastic pencil case lies on the other side.
"Honestly, Jeremy. You shouldn't even be bringing your toys to school. This is a place of learning," the teacher lectured.
"Sorry miss," he apologized again.
"Don't apologize to me. Apologize for wasting your classmates' time."
"Sorry for wasting your time," Jeremy said. The apologies were sounding less sincere each time, but apparently the teacher was satisfied.
"Don't let me catch you playing with toys again or we're going to have a very serious talk... in detention," the teacher warned.
You continue looking around your surroundings, trying to figure out how to escape. The notebook is tall enough to reach the unzipped mouth of the backpack, but it's a hardcover and is far too slick to give you any grip. The cloth of the backpack itself is rough, but not enough to give you a good climbing surface. When you try to, the fabric folds over, making the climbing nearly impossible as you try to scale a surface that is steeper than vertical--it hangs over you. You consider using the pencil case as a ramp, but it's too heavy to move, although you can just barely open it. Inside is a barely-used eraser, a heavy-looking pen, and two short pencils that both showed bite marks from being chewed on. Yuck. You might be able to rig something up with the pencils if you can get over touching them, but just as you're having this thought, the bell rings. Quick as a flash, the opening above you widens and an enormous textbook moves towards you. Thinking quickly, you take shelter...
121122.title: He hides you

1211221.content: Looking not to be squashed by the incoming book, you dive into the pencil case. It's one of those types that slides open and shut, so you can't close it from the inside, but you're safe. The textbook bounces off the case, leaving you rattled but intact. Then, Jeremy zips the bag shut, sealing off the only source of light. When he picks up the bag, the moving cloth sides press against the case, sealing it shut. You take a sigh of relief, when suddenly something smashes you in the side of the head. From the feel of it, it must have been the pen, bouncing as Jeremy lifts up his bag. You clutch your throbbing skull, only to be squashed by the eraser landing on top of you. It's not particularly painful, but it knocks the wind out of you. You shove the eraser off, only to bounce back and smack into the back of the case. The bouncing motion of the backpack has turned this pencil case into a death trap. If you could see, you might have been able to avoid the agitated writing implements, but as it stands, you are helpless to evade. A sharp pain burns in your stomach, and you feel nauseous. Feeling your belly, you can tell that you have been stabbed by one of the pencils. You gasp, clutching at the sharp object and pulling it free. You feel wetness around the wound, and you know that you're bleeding. You blindly pull off what remains of your shirt and try to tie it around the wound, but blind and bleeding out you can't manage to tie a good knot. The pen strikes your face again and you pass out, never to wake up again.
1211221.title: Inside the pencil case

choices: You're still in the backpack, Jeremy is in another class
You've been taken out of the bag in Jeremy's room
1211222.content:
You pull with all your might and manage to pry the cover open a tiny bit, just enough to squeeze in. You feel the heavy thud of the book landing next to you, and you know that you would have been killed instantly had you been underneath it. You hear the distinctive sound of a zipper, and almost all the light inside the backpack vanishes. Then Jeremy lifts his backpack, hoisting it onto his back, and the angle he's carrying it at causes the textbook to press you between the cover and the pages of the notebook. You cry out in pain, pushing back with all of your strength. You're beginning to feel like this was a mistake. Surprisingly, though, you're actually managing to keep the pressure of the book off of yourself. You're not totally sure how you're managing this, but the effort of pushing back is starting to make your arms hurt. The backpack bounces, Jeremy's footsteps causing the book to pound against you with incredible force. Your sore arms begin to shake, and then they give out. You grunt as you are sandwiched between the cover and the first page. You lungs are drained as the force of the impact causes you to exhale sharply, and you struggle to catch your breath. Just when you manage to gasp, another step hits, and you exhale again. Spots dance in the corners of your vision, and you feebly try to get out of the book.
Slam!
Another impact hits, timed perfectly to deprive you of air. Exhausted and suffocating, you pass out.
Where do you wake up?
1211222.title: Inside the notebook

choices: A train heist, with you as a robber
A peaceful train ride, with you as the conductor
A wild west scene, with you tied to the tracks
12112222.content:
You wake up lying on something soft, like thick grass. You roll over and pull yourself up to a seat, noting tenderness in your limbs. You brush yourself off as you take in your surroundings.
You are in a young boy's bedroom, and are lying on a thick, green, plush carpet. You seem to have been classified as a toy and put with all the other toys, which is to say scattered all around the room. Cars, wooden blocks, action figures, a train set, and a few more typically feminine toys, such as dress-up dolls and a doll house, are chaotically arrayed around the carpet. Jeremy sits nearby, slamming two cars together and making sound effects to complement the natural clacking of metal on metal. You try to stand up but a sharp pain in your lower left leg brings you down to your knees. Was it broken? Maybe just bruised. Either way, you decide to rest and watch the boy playing.
Jeremy was probably about your age, eight, maybe nine. He had short, sandy hair and blue eyes. He was wearing a red and blue striped shirt and overalls. After maybe thirty seconds of bashing the vehicles into each other, he made an explosion sound and threw one unfortunate toy car into the air. It bounced once on the plush carpet and landed on its side. Jeremy took the winning car and cruised it around, crawling around and making "vroom" sounds with his mouth. He ended the short car trip with the sound of brakes screeching, and he picked up a doll that was maybe three times your size and tried to put it on the car. No luck, the doll was much too big to fit on top of the vehicle. Unfazed, the boy tossed the car aside and made his way over to his electric train set. The trains were much bigger than the cars, so the doll fit nicely on top of one of the trains, although she was proportionally ridiculous, and Jeremy seemed to recognize it. He looks around the room, and his eyes lock on you. Being much smaller than the doll, you would fit the train much better. You're paralyzed briefly as he reaches over and grabs you in his fist, pinning your arms to your sides. He studies you briefly.
"I don't remember getting you," he says to you. You try to speak but the pressure on your chest from his fist prevents you from doing anything more than wheezing, which he doesn't notice.
He carries you over to the set, where he starts to play out...
12112222.title: Jeremy's room

choices: To hell with Sandy Jones! You escape on your own
121122223.content:
Jeremy puts you down near the tracks, and goes to get a couple of other toys with which to make a story. You are still confused and disoriented, so you don't move as he brings back two identical cowboys on horses, both slightly smaller-scale than you, and a gentleman figure with a towel draped over his arm, clearly once a butler, but with an evil-looking beard scribbled on in marker. The "villain" was nearly twice your size, and he towered over the "heroes" even on their steeds. In one hand he held one of the cowboys, in the other he held the villain.
"Stop in the name of the law, Dirty Randy!" Jeremy proclaimed in a southern accent. He shook the cowboy up and down as he did so to make it clear who was talking. Jeremy gasped, shaking the villain.
"Sandy Jones and his sidekick Buck-Tooth Stu?" the villain seemed to say. The cowboy who wasn't being held fell over as his horse didn't have firm footing on the soft carpet. Jeremy quickly dropped the first cowboy and grabbed the one that had fallen. He proceeded to hurl it across the room, where it smacked into a wooden dresser and fell to the ground.
"Stupid thing. Toys should at least be able to stand still. They're useless if they're moving around and falling over and stuff," Jeremy mumbled, not in the voice of either of the characters. You couldn't see what had happened to "Buck-Tooth Stu" very clearly, but you were pretty sure you had heard plastic breaking on impact. You can't help but envision that happening to you, your body splattering against the hard wood. You swallow hard as Jeremy picks up Sandy Jones again.
"You villain! You killed Buck-Tooth Stu!" Sandy Jones said. Dirty Randy gave out an evil-sounding laugh. Jeremy was a bit of a maniac to his toys, but he did do the voices well, you had to admit.
"That's right, and you're too late to stop my plan!" Dirty Randy said.
"Fiend! What have you done?" Sandy Jones said. Jeremy put down the toys and looked around, muttering "where did I put that..."
His eyes fix on you and he reaches for you. You're about to try to run when you remember Stu's fate, and you freeze, totally rigid. Any resistance you give might be interpreted as you not working correctly, and you weren't eager to become a paste. Jeremy picks you up and carries you to his bed, where he produces a spool of twine from the bedside table. It's not thick, but it's rough, and to you it's like sturdy rope. Your fear of Buck-Tooth Stu's fate keeps you motionless. First, Jeremy ties your ankles together, a tight double-knot that immobilizes your legs. Then he ties a length of twine around your arms and chest, binding you fully. Satisfied with his knots, Jeremy brings you back over to the wild-west scene and positions you on the train tracks, your neck and ankles on the two opposite rails.
"I've kidnapped your girlfriend Annie and tied her to the tracks! You'll never save her!" Jeremy said in Dirty Randy's voice as he picked up the toys again. Using the hand that held the villain, he reached over and switched the train on. An artificial train whistle sounded as the train whirred to life. You had maybe a minute before the train reached you.
"Help me, Sandy Jones!" Jeremy said in a high-pitched falsetto, apparently doing your voice. You squirm slightly, dislodging yourself from the tracks. Jeremy shoots you a frustrated frown and moves you back. Something in his eyes told you that moving again would be even more dangerous than being hit by the train.
"Annie! I'll save you! I'm gonna take you down, Dirty Randy," Sandy Jones said. Now that your life was on the line, you were very invested in this shallow action story. Jeremy began bashing the toys against each other, making "pow" and "bang bang" sound effects. After thirty seconds, the train was starting to get unnervingly close. You decide that you'd rather be at Jeremy's mercy than be hit by a train, and you cry out, but your scream is muffled by another robotic-sounding train whistle. Just then, Sandy Jones seemed to strike a major blow against Dirty Randy. The larger toy staggered back and Jeremy groaned in the villain's voice.
"You may think you've won, Jones, but you have to choose! My life or the girl's! If you finish me off, you'll never have time to save her, but if you save her, I'll have time to escape!" Dirty Randy gloated. Damn that Dirty Randy! Another whistle reminds you of how quickly your doom approaches. What does Sandy Jones choose?
121122223.title: A wild west scene, with you tied to the tracks

choices: The train keeps going, running you over
The train turns off, but its momentum makes it hit you anyway
The train stops just in the nick of time
1211222231.content:
"You've breathed your last, Dirty Randy!" Sandy Jones declared. With one last shake and a "Bang!" Dirty Randy died. He was ceremoniously tossed in the air, and he landed on the bed, crying "Curse you Sandy Jones!"
"I might still be able to save her!" Sandy Jones said. He bounced towards you, much too slowly to intercept the train. You scream again. This time, Jeremy seemed to hear you, but he was engrossed in the scene and didn't react with anything other than a surprised raise of his eyebrows. With a mighty leap, he jumped, horse and all, onto the train. Jeremy fumbled with the switch as the train closed in on you. Ten inches. Five. Two. One! You scream and close your eyes tight, not wanting to face your own doom.
1211222231.title: He finishes Dirty Randy

12112222311.content: "No! I'm too late!" Sandy Jones exclaimed. Just then, you feel a heavy impact on your throat and ankles, followed by another, and then another. You choke and gasp in pain, then you feel a snapping sound and a sharp pain goes up your leg. If it wasn't broken before, it definitely is now. You try to scream but the train hits your throat again, and you black out instantly as your neck snaps.
12112222311.title: The train keeps going, running you over

choices: Stay in Jeremy's room and pretend to be a toy
Stay in Jeremy's room and try to get his attention when he gets back
Go exploring outside of Jeremy's room
12112222312.content:
You hear the hum of the train's engine suddenly end, and you are relieved for the brief moment before the train rolls into you. Fortunately, your body acts as a fairly decent brake for the vehicle. Unfortunately, it hurts like hell to have your windpipe crushed by a train. Only the first wheels manage to make it over you, and for a brief instant, you are squashed under the enormous tin train, but Jeremy picks it up quickly and looks down at you. You're still tied up, so you can't move. You try to say something, but your throat has just been compressed and you can't form words properly, so you just gag. Jeremy seems to regard you with confusion for a few moments before continuing with his Wild West fantasy. He lifts you up and shakes you as he speaks, which leaves you dizzy.
"Oh, thank you so much for saving me!" Jeremy says in his absurd falsetto. Apparently Jeremy has decided to disregard the train continuing onto you.
"Any time, Annie. Lemme just untie those ropes for you and we'll be on our way back to town," he replies in his Sandy Jones voice. He puts down the cowboy figure and lifts you up close to his face so he can concentrate on the knots. He picks at the tight bundle of twine, but his short nails can't get good purchase on the small knots, so he instead drops you on the (thankfully soft) carpet, grabs a pair of safety scissors, and with surprising dexterity cuts through the string. Before you have a chance to move, he grabs you again, places you on the horse behind Sandy Jones and, carrying the two of you in one hand, "gallops" the horse across the carpet.
"Jeremy! Dinnertime!" A woman's voice calls from outside the room.
"Coming, Mom!" Jeremy replies. He drops you and the cowboy and dashes out of the room.
You gather yourself up and rub your stinging throat. After a few minutes and a lot of coughing, your voice seems to work again, and it seems that your leg isn't broken after all, so you're now free to do whatever you'd like.
What do you do?
12112222312.title: Curse you, momentum!

choices: Jeremy is a good boy, he'll help you however he can
Jeremy is selfish, he wants you all to himself
Jeremy is evil, he wants to make your life a living hell
12112222313.content:
The hum of the train's motor ceases, and the toy vehicle comes to a near-immediate halt. The cheap motors used on the model train don't allow the wheels to spin when the motor is off, so it slides a half an inch before coming to a complete stop. The danger averted, you breathe a sigh of relief. Jeremy sets down the cowboy figure and picks you up, examining you more closely.
"Hello?" you call as he holds you in front of his face
"You can talk?" he asks
"I can also usually move," you say, wriggling for emphasis.
"Whoa," he gasps
"Could you untie me? I'm getting very sore," you say. As he struggles with the knots, he continues to ask questions.
"What kind of toy are you?"
"I'm not a toy, I'm a girl."
"Why are you so small?"
"I don't know."
"Why were you on my shoe?"
"I was about to get trampled in the hall, so I grabbed a random shoe. That was your shoe."
"Why didn't you tell me sooner?"
"I was trying at first, and then you scared me when you threw your cowboy across the room."
"Oh, sorry," Jeremy apologizes. He finally loosens the knot binding your hands, and the string falls away.
"Let me get my feet, my hands are smaller."
Jeremy holds his palm open and sets you down on it so that you are sitting in the middle of his hand. You reach down and struggle briefly with the knot before it comes undone. It took you a bit longer than expected because although you certainly have greater dexterity than Jeremy, the knot is very tight and you are very weak.
With the knots undone, you hop up and down in Jeremy's hand, trying to dispel the irritating pins and needles in your feet. Jeremy laughs.
"That tickles!" he says.
"Sorry, my feet fell asleep."
"That's okay. What's your name?"
"Sarah," you say. Sensation returns to your extremities, and you sit down again.
"Do you want to be my friend?" Jeremy asks.
"Sure thing. You're Jeremy, right?"
"Yep!"
"Great. I think we'll be good friends. Can you help me figure out why I'm so small and maybe get me back to normal size?"
How does Jeremy feel about this?
12112222313.title: The train stops just in the nick of time

choices: Jeremy, ready to play some more games
Jeremy, bearing food and drink for you
Jeremy's mother, who notices the jar as she puts away clean socks
121122223132.content:
"How do I know you'll still want to be friends when you're big again?" Jeremy demands, an edge creeping into his voice. You hide your nervousness.
"Of course I will! You're a good person and you're really good at using your imagination," you say, trying to reassure him.
"You think so?" he asks.
"Sure!" you affirm.
"You were a good toy, too!" he says.
"Thanks! I'm glad you didn't squash me."
"Don't worry, I'll be more careful next time," Jeremy promises.
"Next time? I thought you were going to help me grow back," you prod, but Jeremy shakes his head.
"No. I'm going to keep you and then we can play every day and you'll never go away," the enormous boy decides.
"H-hey!" you exclaim as he suddenly stuffs you inside the large pocket on the front of his overalls. You tumble to the bottom of the rough pouch, landing on a lint-filled seam in the denim. You start climbing out, which is relatively easy thanks to the two opposing walls of coarse fabric, but just as you're getting close to escaping his hand pokes in and knocks you back down. The message was clear: you wouldn't be escaping.
You could tell that Jeremy was moving, but you couldn't tell what he was doing. The fabric was totally opaque, and the opening of the pocket didn't let you see anything more than his chest and chin. Eventually, he pulled open the pocket with one hand and grabbed for you with the other. You resist, but he pinches you by your right ankle as you scramble away from him. He lifts you out of the pocket and you dangle upside-down for a moment. Your shirt briefly flops over your face, but you push it back into place and tuck it into your jeans. Then, he drops you. You land on your head in a large glass jar. A large white patch on the glass shows that it has a label of some sort, but you can't read it from the inside. You hear a scratching sound and look up to see the lid being screwed back into place. He seems to have poked several tiny holes in the lid for air. You bang on the glass, shouting protests. Jeremy opens his dresser and nestles you in among his clean socks and underwear. You yell one last plea before he slams the door shut, sealing you in darkness.
You consider escape, but you know that your efforts would be totally futile. Even if you could somehow get to the lid, there was no way you'd be able to open it. You're not even sure you'd be able to open the jar from the inside even with the strength of your normal size. You pound against the glass, but it barely even makes a sound. A dull "thunk" is the most you can get out of it. You're certainly sustaining more damage from this than the glass is. Defeated, you submit to the oppressive darkness and wait.

You must have fallen asleep at some point, because you wake up. Your lips are dry and your stomach is growling, but the blackness all around you persists, unrelenting. If possible, it seemed even darker than before. You rise to your feet and try the glass again. No luck. Just as you sit back down, a sudden jerking motion nearly slams you into the wall. The drawer is opening. Who opened the drawer?
121122223132.title: Jeremy is selfish, he wants you all to himself

1211222231321.content:
The lid of the jar pops open and Jeremy grins down at you.
"Hey, Sarah. How are you feeling?" he asks.
"I'm hungry, thirsty, and tired. Let me go!" you shout. The shape of the glass amplifies your voice, so he hears you clearly.
"Oh, shoot, I forgot about feeding you. Come here," he says. He tries to reach into the glass, but his hand gets stuck in the opening, so instead he just lifts up the container and dumps you out. You tumble into his hand.
The layout of Jeremy's room has changed slightly. Most of the toys have been put away, and dominating the center of the room was some strange adaptation of his dollhouse. The boy seemed to have used a staggering number of Lego bricks to construct various additions to the house, turning it from a quaint urban residence into a medieval castle. High (well, proportionally high) towers rose above the building, and crenelated walls ran around a plastic courtyard. He had used the carpet for the grass in the courtyard, with plastic trees and shrubs dotted about, but none of that was the most impressive part. Behind the main building was a huge, circular arena, constructed entirely out of Lego. It was staggering in scale, and you refused to believe that he had built the entire thing in one day. Had you been in that jar for longer than a day? Impossible. You were thirsty but not "haven't had anything to drink in two days" thirsty.
"Wow," you say. You were still quite justifiably furious at Jeremy, but you couldn't deny that this was seriously impressive.
"Thanks. It's not done yet, the towers don't have furniture yet, Cole's going to let me borrow his toy furniture," Jeremy says. You realize suddenly that the entire project is consistent in its scale, and it's all about the right size for you.
"This is your castle," Jeremy says. You felt conflicted. This had been a serious labor of love from the boy, but on the other hand he had literally kidnapped you, so it didn't quite even out.
"Jeremy, this is incredible, but I just want to get back to normal. Please help me," you beg. Jeremy frowns a dangerous frown and puts you into the courtyard.
"Make yourself at home, Sarah. You'll live here while I'm awake, and I'll make your jar more comfortable for at night. I don't want you trying to run away," Jeremy says.
"Please! I'm not a toy, I'm a person! You can't just keep me!" you shout. Jeremy smiles.
"Yes I can. Now don't try to run away, I'm going to get you some food," he says before leaving the room. You immediately look for an exit, and your eyes lock on the main gates of the castle. A plastic portcullis blocks the way, and beyond that a brown Lego drawbridge is raised. You decide to look for another way. You run inside the dollhouse and quickly ascend the stairs. On the second floor, you can reach the tower and the top of the walls, both of which have access points from the missing wall that lets people interact with the toys inside. You make your way out onto the walls. The tops of the walls are arrayed with the studs on the tops of the Lego bricks, and you immediately trip over one of the studs. Despite being tiny, they're about two inches tall to you. Trying to run across them is like running on an uneven cobblestone road. You look down to the outside. The walls are slick, with the tiny cracks between bricks too small for even your diminutive fingers to fit inside of, but you think you could survive the fall. You hear footsteps approaching. Do you take the risk?
1211222231321.title: Game-Master Jeremy

12112222313212.content:
You decide not to take the chance. Even if you land safely, you know you won't be able to escape his room without him noticing, and he'd probably find and punish you. Again, the image of the cowboy smashing against the dresser flashes through your mind and you shudder.
Sure enough, only a few seconds after you make the decision, the door opens and Jeremy enters. He places some wrinkled, green and brown object on the dollhouse's kitchen table, and sets an upside-down plastic bottle cap on the floor beside it.
"What do you think?" Jeremy asks.
"It's very neat, but I--"
"Don't ask for me to let you go. I'm not gonna."
"I wasn't going to," you lie, "I was just going to say that I'm so hungry."
"Well good thing I brought you dinner!" Jeremy says, pointing to the miniature kitchen. You walk over, taking care on the Lego studs, and approach the alien-looking object on the kitchen table. It seems to be some sort of plant, and it smells familiar, but you can't place it. You're certain that you'd be able to identify it in an instant if it weren't absurdly massive.
"What... is this?" you ask.
"It's a pistachio," Jeremy says. Sure enough, now that he mentions it, you recognize the object as a huge, shelled pistachio. You're certain that you could sustain yourself on this alone for months. Looking over at the bottle cap, you see that it's filled with water. You struggle with the huge nut for a minute before managing to sink your teeth into it. It's a truly bizarre experience. The pistachio flavor is unmistakable, but it feels very strange having such a large piece of it. After a short while of chewing, you swallow it. You've never loved pistachios, but you'd never been so hungry before, so the pistachio seemed delicious. You go over to the bottle cap and lower your head down to the surface of the water, taking several long gulps. When you come up again for air, you realize that this too is enough for literally months. It's like drinking from a bathtub. You glance up and see Jeremy looking down at you.
"Are you done?" he asks.
"Give me a minute, I'll let you know," you say. You continue to eat mouthfuls of pistachio and gulp down the cool, clear water until you've had your fill.
"Okay, Jeremy. What did you want to do?" you ask. You're not thrilled about the idea of giving your spoiled captor exactly what he wants, but you don't see any alternatives. Well, other than him killing you.
"Come over to the arena. You can get there through the tower," he says. You comply, heading into the tower and then through a corridor into the arena area. The ground is the same texture as the walls and the other Lego floors, with small studs all around. You have just come in through a large archway, and three other archways are arranged around the edge of the arena. The other archways are blocked by large Lego doors. The stands are sparsely filled with Lego people, their bald yellow heads and emotionless faces seeming to stare you down. You walk into the middle of the area and see that he has left you some equipment, several pieces of Lego gear: a sword, a shield, and a helmet. They're about the right size for you.
"Try them on so we can play!" Jeremy says. You pick up the plastic, medieval-style helmet. It's about the right size for you, but it weighs more than a bowling ball, and you have some trouble lifting it. You place it on your head, stagger about for a moment, and then lose your balance, crashing down. Fortunately the helmet blunts the impact slightly. You slide your head out of its plastic prison.
"It's too heavy!" you call.
"Oh, I didn't think about that," Jeremy replies, "Try the sword and shield!"
You try to lift the sword, but in addition to it weighing as much as the helmet, the handle is too thick to hold comfortably, even with two hands. The shield has similar problems.
"No good. My hands are just a bit too small," you say. Jeremy seems to think for a moment.
"Be right back," he says, and he runs out of the room.
You start walking around the arena, getting an idea of its layout and getting used to the studs under your feet. You've nearly made it to one of the doors in the walls when Jeremy returns.
"Try this," he says, handing you a long, pointed wooden cylinder. A toothpick. You take it. It's about half as heavy as the plastic toys, and the slightly smaller size is perfect for you to use in two hands like a spear.
"That's a lot better," you say.
"Great! then we can get started!" Jeremy says, taking away the heavy plastic gear.
"Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Colosseum! Today, we will be watching the gladiator Sarah in her first match!" Jeremy says in a deep announcer's voice. He then imitates a roaring and cheering crowd, and you wave at the plastic audience.
"The gladiator Sarah will today be battling..."
12112222313212.title: Stay on the wall.

choices: It lunges with its open mouth
121122223132123.content:
"The gladiator Sarah, condemned to death in the arena, will be battling a mighty swamp monster! Six knights died in the effort of capturing this horrible beast. Be warned, these walls may not be enough to hold it!" Jeremy announces in his showman's voice.
"Wait, condemned to death?" you exclaim.
"Don't worry, you'll be fine. Just hold it off for a little while and I'll take it out again," Jeremy says in his normal voice.
"What are you talking about?"
"And let the battle begin!" Announcer-Jeremy exclaims as he pushes open the door opposite you, revealing your opponent. An enormous, slimy creature crawls through the doorway, regarding you with its wide, yellow eyes. It's a colossal frog. Its head towers over you, about twice your height, and it's more than twice as long as it is tall. You step back, and it steps forward.
"Jeremy, I don't want to fight this thing!" you shout, not taking your eyes off of the monstrous amphibian.
"It seems our brave gladiator has lost her nerve! Perhaps we will not get a glorious spectacle after all!" Announcer-Jeremy narrates.
You step back again, and it steps forward. Its steps being much longer than yours, you're losing precious ground very quickly. You freeze, and the frog does as well. Ten seconds pass as you and the frog stare each other down. You hear Jeremy making booing sounds.
"The crowd is getting restless! They want action! Blood!"
"It's going to eat me!" You scream, beginning to cry from helplessness and terror.
"No, you're too big," Jeremy says. You're not so sure about that. You raise your toothpick spear towards the frog, who seems not to notice. Jeremy reaches in and nudges the frog's backside. The monster steps forward and you nearly drop your spear.
Time seems to slow down. You remember seeing frogs hunting by the pond. Their tongues give them immense range and speed. You could never dodge that. You're outmatched in strength, size, and speed, but you're smarter and have tools.
The entire thought happens in the blink of an eye, and you step toward the frog, brandishing the spear and shouting. It blinks at you but doesn't move. You're getting close now. A few more steps and you'll be in range with your toothpick. You step closer, and flinch as the frog shifts its weight. Once it seems to have stopped moving again, you step forward. Suddenly, the frog attacks!
121122223132123.title: Jeremius Caesar takes the game too far

choices: Jeremy squeezes a bit too hard
1211222231321231.content:
Fast as the blink of an eye, the frog shoots out its tongue. You can't react quickly enough to block the sticky muscle with your toothpick. Pink flesh wraps around your torso and you shriek as the frog simultaneously lunges forward and pulls you in. The sudden movement makes you drop your weapon. In an instant, you are inside the frog's mouth. You thrash wildly for a moment, but the saliva is incredibly sticky and within seconds you're stuck almost completely. You feel so much motion you can't tell what's happening. The warm chamber constricts and you feel a tug pulling you deeper into the frog. You are powerless to resist.
"Hey! HEY! Spit her out!" Jeremy shouts. Around you, you feel the environment change again. Instead of a tight tube, you are now in a snug-fitting fleshy pouch. It's just the right size for you. You're inside the frog's stomach.
The liquids in the stomach are different than in its mouth, and you find yourself relatively unstuck. You writhe with all your strength, but make no noticeable impact on the huge creature.
"It was just supposed to be a game!" Jeremy yells. You feel a violent and aggressive squeeze as Jeremy tries to force the frog to spit you back out.
Does he succeed?
1211222231321231.title: It shoots out its tongue

1211222231321232.content:
You see it moving towards you, a quick lunge with its mouth open. You hurl yourself aside, bashing yourself against the uneven ground. The frog's huge bulk goes right by you, and you're left with an opening. Not even thinking, you stab with all your strength. You make solid contact, but don't break its skin. The frog jumps backward, shrinking down slightly. It seems to have recognized that you aren't just a snack. You pull yourself to your feet and advance towards the frog. You have to press the advantage until it decides fully that you're not worth the trouble. You rush forward, screaming, and thrust again. With your momentum behind the attack, you pierce through its slimy hide and embed the toothpick a short distance into the frog's abdomen. The frog leaps right over you, and the toothpick comes back out. The tip is red with blood. You watch the frog land and leap again, clearing the walls of the arena.
"Whoa!" Jeremy exclaims as he rushes over to catch it. You sit down and catch your breath, and soon Jeremy stands up, holding the frog. He puts it down somewhere, presumably in some sort of aquarium or cage.
"We have a champion!" Announcer-Jeremy exclaims. The announcement is accompanied by him imitating the crowd cheering.
"STOP!" you scream at the top of your voice. The crowd falls silent.
"Jeremy, I almost died. That frog would have swallowed me whole. If this is the sort of game you want to play, I beg you, please don't play it with me," you sob. Jeremy is silent for a moment.
How does Jeremy react?
1211222231321232.title: Sarah the Frog Fighter

12112222313212321.content:
"You're right. I'm sorry. I really am. I just wanted to give you an exciting experience. I didn't think it through," Jeremy apologizes. You're somewhat surprised by his sincerity.
"I accept your apology, just no more fighting live animals please? I thought we went over this after the train. Playing is fine, just don't hurt me."
"Still, that was so COOL! You were like a real gladiator!" Jeremy exclaims, his eyes brightening with excitement.
"You think so?"
"Totally! I couldn't have done that."
"Well, in the future, I'd rather stick with fighting toys," you say, blushing at his complement.
"Definitely. I wouldn't want anything to happen to you," the enormous boy promises.
Victorious, you leave the arena and return to the kitchen, where you take a long drink and then splash some of the water in your face.
"You know what? I'm going to let you stay in the castle overnight. I'm just going to trust that you won't run away," Jeremy decides. You look up at the boy. His face is red and his eyes show compassion. You think he's serious.
Do you try to run away?
12112222313212321.title: He understands

choices: Nothing changes. Five more years pass
Jeremy realizes he has feelings for you
121122223132123213.content:
You decide to stay with Jeremy as long as he keeps you safe. The fight with the frog was a harrowing reminder of your own mortality, and while he hadn't proven himself to be the most trustworthy guardian, he had at least given you a home and promised to protect you.
Time passes. Search parties go out within the next day, looking for you, but nobody suspects that you were Jeremy Zimmerman's shrunken toy. Within a few months, the search ends. Your face shows up on local milk cartons for a few more months, but eventually you're assumed dead.
Right around when the search parties ended, Jeremy's mother, Cynthia, discovered you when she came into his room looking for him while you were in the courtyard. She had talked with Jeremy and agreed to let him keep you as long as you were willing and he took care of you. Jeremy's father had passed away in a construction accident three years ago, so it was just the two of them. Maybe she felt lonely, which was why she agreed to take care of you.
Over time, you hone your body and mind. You practice lifting small objects like Lego bricks, run around the courtyard and walls, and climb various parts of the castle to grow stronger. Eventually you're able to wear the Lego gear that Jeremy had given you. At the same time, you continue to learn. Jeremy shares his class notes and homework with you, so you continue to gain your education, and you both strain your brains playing strategy and puzzle games against each other, like chess and Scrabble. Jeremy had won the first dozen or so games of chess, since he had the advantage of being able to see the entire board at once, but you eventually learned to envision the board as a whole, so eventually you became good rivals. Chess was also a good physical workout, since you had to exert enormous effort to move the pieces.
Ms. Zimmerman had also accepted you as part of the family. She made new clothes for you, made some custom miniature furniture, and supported a balanced and healthy diet. You were very grateful for her assistance.
By age ten you had become extremely fit (for a child), and once puberty hit at twelve you started to put on some lean muscle. At age thirteen, you had grown enough to be able to use the Lego helmet and shield, although you still preferred a toothpick over the bulky, unbalanced Lego weapons. When you did fight in the arena, your foes were plastic and controlled by Jeremy. You usually won, but always emerged with some bruises from the plastic hitting you.
Does anything change as both you and Jeremy reach maturity?
121122223132123213.title: Five years a toy

choices: Decide to let them work on it
Lily refuses to let you help
1211222231321232133.content:
One November afternoon, Jeremy comes home with a huge grin on his face. You're climbing the tower at the time, and he bursts into his room with such force that you're thrown off. You land safely on the carpet, rolling with the impact. You spring to your feet.
"Sarah! Guess what?" Jeremy exclaims.
"What?"
"She said yes!"
"I don't know what you're talking about," you say.
"Lily! She agreed to be my girlfriend!" Jeremy explains. You remember Lily. She was the same age as you. She was a quiet girl with black hair, brown eyes, and a slim build who preferred to keep to herself. Jeremy had told you over the past years about how he was becoming friends with her, and you were all in favor of it. Lily needed some friends.
